document.docAuthor: Sankaran, Pradeep M., Malamel, Jobi J., Joseph, Mathew M. & Sebastian, Pothalil A.
document.docTitle: Martensopoda sanctor Sankaran, Malamel, Joseph & Sebastian, 2015, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: An updated review of the genus Martensopoda Jäger, 2006 (Araneae: Sparassidae: Heteropodinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: An updated review of the genus Martensopoda Jäger, 2006 (Araneae: Sparassidae: Heteropodinae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material: Holotype :
Male ( ADSH 920134 A),
INDIA : Kerala :
Trivandrum, Kallar in Ponmudi,
8 o 45 ' 35.79 ''N
,
77 o07'00.75''E
,
920 m .
alt., 0
4 October 2014
, M.S. Pradeep leg. by hand;
Paratype :
1 female
( ADSH 920234 A), same data as holotype .

Diagnosis. Males of
M. sanctor
sp. nov.
can be separated from all other described congeners by the following combination of characters: embolus with a distal, oblique twist forming a wide loop (
Figs 1 D
,
2 C
), while in
M. minuscula
, the distal, oblique embolic twist forms a narrow loop (
Figs 4 D
,
5 C
), and in
M. transversa
, the distal, oblique embolic twist is absent (
Jäger 2006 : figs. 2, 5
); embolic apophysis separates medially from the embolus (
Figs 1 D
,
2 C
), but in both
M. minuscula
(
Figs 4 D
,
5 C
) and
M. transversa
(
Jäger 2006 : figs. 1, 2, 5
), embolic apophysis separates distally from the embolus; conductor with a disto-retrolateral, flattened, tongue shaped extension (
Figs 1 C–D
,
2 B–D
), but in both
M. minuscula
(
Figs 4 C–D
,
5 B–D
) and
M. transversa
(
Jäger 2006 : figs. 2, 5
), conductor lacks such modification; hook-like cymbial spur (
Figs 1 F
,
2 E
), but in both
M. minuscula
(
Figs 4 F
,
5 E
) and
M. transversa
(
Jäger 2006 : figs. 3, 4
), it is simple and curved. Female can be recognized by median part of the internal duct system which is lying only along the posterior part of the median line (
Figs 1 J
,
3 B
), but in both
M. minuscula
(
Figs 4 J
,
6 B
) and
M. transversa
(
Fig. 8 B
,
Jäger 2006
: fig. 10 ), it lies along the entire length of the median line.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1A–J.
Martensopoda sanctor
sp. nov.
A–B Male (holotype) habitus (A dorsal, B ventral); C–F Male left pedipalp (C prolateral, D ventral, E retrolateral, F dorsal); G–H Female (paratype) habitus (G dorsal, H ventral). I Epigyne, ventral view; J Vulva, dorsal view.

FIGURES 2A–E.
Martensopoda sanctor
sp. nov.
Male left pedipalp (A entire prolateral, B enlarged prolateral, C ventral, D retrolateral, E dorsal). Abbreviations: C conductor, E embolus, EA embolic apophysis, PB prolateral bulge of cymbium, RTA retrolateral tibial apophysis, SP spur of cymbium. Scale bars: A, 1mm; B–E, 0.4 mm.

FIGURES 3A–C.
Martensopoda sanctor
sp. nov.
A Epigyne, ventral view; B Vulva, dorsal view; C Schematic course of internal duct system, dorsal view. Abbreviations: FD fertilization duct, LL lateral loops of internal duct system, MS median septum, PP pit posterior to septum, R spiral rim of copulatory opening. Scale bars: A–B, 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Description. Male ( holotype ): Prosoma uniformly reddish-brown with dark, faint markings (
Figs 1 A–B
). Eye field reddish-brown, hirsute; eyes with distinct dark patches. Clypeus reddish-brown. Chelicerae, maxillae, labium, sternum yellowish-brown. Cheliceral promargin with 3 teeth, retromargin with 4 teeth; promargin provided with a row of long, curved hairs. Maxillae with reduced scopulae. Sternum without markings. Opisthosoma elongated oval, reddish-brown, hirsute; dorsum provided with four pairs of white spots; venter yellowish-brown. Spinnerets yellowish-brown with black shades. Leg segments reddish-brown with black shades on all patellae, tibiae, metatarsi and tarsi; all trochanters notched; metatarsus IV less scopulated; all other metatarsi and all tarsi with well developed scopulae. Body length 7.53 . Prosoma length 4.42 , width 4.25 . Opisthosoma length 3.11 , width 2.47 . Eye diameters: AME 0.11 . ALE 0.29 . PME 0.20 . PLE 0.32 . Eye interdistances: AME–AME 0.14 . AME–ALE 0.06 . AME–PME 0.38 . ALE–PLE 0.32 . PME–PME 0.32 . PME–PLE 0.41 . Clypeus height at AME 0.30 , at ALE 0.27 . Chelicera length 1.84 . Measurements of palp and legs: Palp 6.58 [ 1.98 , 0.94 , 0.98 , 2.68 ], I 18.37 [ 5.34 , 2.16 , 5.05 , 4.43 , 1.39 ], II 21.5 [ 6.35 , 2.28 , 6.18 , 5.03 , 1.66 ], III 17.69 [ 5.31 , 1.90 , 4.70 , 4.30 , 1.48 ], IV 19.83 [ 5.73 , 1.75 , 5.12 , 5.44 , 1.79 ]. Leg formula: 2413 . Spination. Palp: femur 131 , patella 101 , tibia 2111 , tarsus 3000 ; legs: femora I–III 323 , IV 322 ; patellae I–IV 101 ; tibiae
I–II 2026
,
III–IV 2126
; metatarsi I–II 0 0 0 4 ,
III 2014
(right 1012 ), IV 3036 (right 3024 ). Pedipalp (
Figs 1 C–F
,
2 A–E
): Palpal segments reddish-brown. Prolateral bulge of cymbium prominent ( 1 D, 2 C). Tip of embolic apophysis serrated (
Figs 2 B–C
). Conductor wide, membranous, situated distally on the tegulum, provided with a disto-retrolateral, flattened, tongue shaped extension (
Figs 1 C–D
,
2 A–D
). RTA slender, directed at 1 -o’clock position in ventral view (
Fig 2 C
) with a distal bifurcation forming two short, unequal branches; retrolateral branch with a distal bifurcation (
Figs 1 D
,
2 C–D
). Cymbial spur slender, hook-like, directed at 2.30 -o’clock position in ventral view ( 1 F, 2 E).

Female ( paratype ): In all details like male except the following: Prosoma uniformly yellowish (
Figs 1 G–H
). Eye field yellowish-brown. Clypeus, chelicerae brown. Maxillae, labium, sternum yellowish-brown. Opisthosoma squarish, yellowish-brown. Leg and palpal segments yellowish-brown. Body length 9.47 . Prosoma length 4.61 , width 4.52 . Opisthosoma length 4.86 , width 2.91 . Eye diameters: AME 0.16 . ALE 0.30 . PME 0.20 . PLE 0.35 . Eye interdistances: AME–AME 0.19 . AME–ALE 0.07 . AME–PME 0.38 . ALE–PLE 0.30 . PME–PME 0.33 . PME–PLE 0.45 . Clypeus height at AME 0.33 , at ALE 0.29 . Chelicera length 2.18 . Measurements of palp and legs: Palp 6.10 [ 1.88 , 0.89 , 1.24 , 2.09 ], I 15.02 [ 4.41 , 2.07 , 3.73 , 3.58 , 1.23 ], II 17.22 [ 5.20 , 2.24 , 4.41 , 4.01 , 1.36 ], III 14.05 [ 4.46 , 1.83 , 3.39 , 3.20 , 1.17 ], IV 15.53 [ 4.71 , 1.75 , 3.70 , 3.90 , 1.47 ]. Leg formula: 2413 . Spination. Palp: femur 131 , patella 101 , tibia 2121 , tarsus 1014 ; legs: femur I–II 323 , III 322 , IV 321 ; patellae I–IV 001; tibia
I 1026
,
II–III 2026
,
IV 2024
; metatarsi I–II 0 0 0 4 ,
III 2014
, IV 3036 . Copulatory organ (
Figs
1 I
–J
,
3 A–C
): Epigynal field nearly oval (
Figs
1 I
,
3 A
). Median septum slightly narrowing distally, with a triangular posterior pit (
Figs
1 I
,
3 A
). Rims around copulatory openings forming a narrow circle (
Figs
1 I
,
3 A
). Lateral loops of internal duct system extending posteriorly not to receptacula (
Figs 1 J
,
3 B
). Median part of the internal duct system visible only at the posterior part of the median line (
Figs 1 J
,
3 B
).

Etymology. The specific epithet is a term in apposition and is derived from the combination of two Latin words: sanctus (sacred) + cor (heart), referring to the name of the home institution of the authors, Sacred Heart College .

Natural history. Both male and female of
M. sanctor
sp. nov.
were collected from leaf litter in a semievergreen forest floor.
